item.title: Right Track, Wrong Station
item.description: [whitebox] [big]Today in Tedium: Trying to codify and organize things is really hard. Case in point: When Amazon tried to launch a cashier-free grocery store concept late last year, the company saw a lot of problems crop up when too many customers used the store at the same time. On a macro level, the railroad industry once faced similar problems with automatically tracking thingsâ€”a problem they started working on 60 years ago, without the benefits of modern innovation.
